intro: Saussurea lhozhagensis, commonly known as the Tibetan safflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, particularly in Tibet and Nepal. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Saussurea lhozhagensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
